column1: 1$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$2/26/2015 4:39:46 PM$Reviewer: Flemdog
column2: 13-18 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $4$4$5$Started taking in Grade 3 and then switched to concerta
column3: bad mistake got very agressive and tertorial
column4: attack my sister for no reason and got for angry over some like food not perfect
column5: which is the complete opposite of me
column6: then switched back to ritialin and everything has been good
column7: I still get C grades but
column8: a lot better when I'm on ritilin.

column1: 2$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$5/18/2014 10:21:11 PM$Reviewer: Over40momma
column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Caregiver) $3$2$4$"My daughter has been on Ritalin LA for six years. Started with 5mg back in 6th grade and has slowly increases dosage over the years.  She just recently went to 30 mg.  She gets good grades in school and is able to focus
column3: but she notices that she is quieter in school while on it. The days she forgets to take it the ""real"" her comes out and she is talkative and fun to be around. She does
column5: get ""C"" grades on those days.  Since switching to 30mg she has been moodier
column7: and she cries more easily.  These are heightened on the weekends when she usually sleeps too late to take it.  Her boyfriend says she has less emotion and doesn't have an interest in things.  She also has a lot of headaches.  I think    we may have to switch her medication.  It's unfortunate that in order to focus and do well in school she has to take something that keeps her true personality from showing.  Have others experienced any of these symptoms? I do have to say that children as young as 5/6 shouldn't be on this medication unless they are completely out of control in school.  And they should never need medication at that age just to get through homework. and it shouldn't be needed in order for them to do homework. Homework at that age isn't necessary. "

column1: 5$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$6/10/2012 5:08:48 PM$Reviewer: Al442
column2: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $5$5$5$"Prescribed to help me pass my Engineering exams.  Although I give it great reviews
column3: its more for what its not prescribed for than what it is.  I got A's and B's in Calculus 1
column10: this drug will make you want to have sex all day and it is a distraction. Its almost painful how the mind will not deviate from this topic.  Also
column11: when the drug wears off many people feel ""nervous"" but in my opinion this is when you can get the most work done because whatever you focus on will be worked on
column12: you just have to ignore the depression or jitters.  Do not take this drug everyday!  I took 30mg capsule about once a week and the mind really doesn't stop racing for about a week.  You can sleep about 24 hours after taking a 30mg capsule
column13: but the mind seems to remember how to function correctly well after that.

column1: One final note is that when the drug does wear off
column2: waking up is very very difficult

column1: 9$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$8/12/2010 10:09:53 AM$Reviewer: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $1$1$4$I started this medication three days ago.  Although it works just as well as shorter dose
column2: I find that when it wears off
column3: I have a drop off ... sadness is the best way to describe it.  The information that came with it did not mention this issue
column4: but things I have read since mention the possibility.

column1: 10$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$3/3/2010 3:48:05 PM$Reviewer: GoGoSarah
column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$5$5$Love It! It is the miracle drug that I have always needed but when younger refused
column3: if only I knew!  I can focus now more then ever. I once was not able to study with ANY noise around and now the TV can be on no problem.  I was on 10 mg twice a day and now I'm at 20mg.  I do not have any side effects other than great energy and the ability to focus on homework and work.  Its great it has improved every aspect of my life. I am careful of not taking it 3 hours before bed because it does take me about 5 minutes longer to fall asleep.  Drink a pop around the peek of my medicine working has helped an nervous feeling that I have.  With that in mind this helps me have all the positives and none of the negatives of the drug.  If your thinking about taking this drug
column4: just do it becuase you will never regret this.

column1: 11$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$2/2/2010 10:01:55 PM$Reviewer: mariecopage
column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $4$3$3$I am 28yrs old and I been on this medication for about three years now
column4: I kept my job finally for 4 years and I was able focus on school
column5: this medication was a miracle to me! so I thought. I am on 30miligrams a day and it seems that my body has been reacting different towards it.I think I'm getting immune to the drug
column7: and lately I have really bad ticks
column8: prickling and my thumbs and my focus has been off as well. It's scary because I really want to get off of it before things get worse
column9: the only thing stopping me is school
column10: I worry that I will be completely off focus and I wont be able to finish school. Today I didn't take it and i was in a great mood
column11: normally when I'm on it I am depressed and guarded. I really don't know what to do from here.

column1: 16$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$11/11/2008 2:48:18 PM$Reviewer: [email protected]
column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year$4$5$5$I Have already posted on here about my 6yr.old son he is now 7 and been on ritalin LA for 8 months now.I hate when people say don't give your 5
column4: 7 yr.old medication their to little. But I think as parents we know them better then anyone else does and we know when they need a little help controlling themselves.Belieive me giving my son meds was the last thing I wanted to do. This medication helps him get through school and have good evenings at home. I have no complaints. He eats
column6: and he isn't a zomby like the other medication vyvanse made him. He gets a good 7-8hrs out of it and slowly comes down in the evening. he's on 30mg and thats what seems to work for him.

column1: 17$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$11/2/2008 10:52:08 AM$Reviewer: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $4$4$3$
18$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$10/1/2008 2:12:24 AM$Reviewer: Jimrobert
column2: 19-24 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $4$4$3$"I began taking this medicine when I was about 17(20 now) and I would be very careful giving this medicine to younger children. It alters your personality as well as helping you focus and stay on track with your activities. It does not substitute for a good work ethic or diligence however
column3: those skills must be trained not drugged.

column1: This medicine does give an extreme drop off after approximately 6 hours after the dosage and is rather rough on one mentally.
Almost as if you were watching one channel of tv and suddenly someone else grabs the remote and switches channels without your control.

I felt I needed to post because I read of so many VERY young children being given this powerful drug and I believe that discipline must first be attempted before jumping into giving your 5 year old drugs."

column1: 23$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$3/23/2008 2:00:15 PM$Reviewer: [email protected]
column2: 3-6 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $4$4$5$My 6yr.old son has been on this medication for a week now and seems to be doing ok. a lot better than he did on vyvanse. the only side effect I see is that at lunch time he does not eat. so far so good. no depression no insomnia no crying.(all with which we had with vyvanse).

column1: 24$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$3/12/2008 10:04:44 PM$Reviewer: daisey826
column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Caregiver) $4$3$5$My daughter was 5 when diagnosed with ADHD.  She started on Ritalin LA as her first medication attempt a few months later when school started.  She did good on it for a while.  We got up to 30mg daily but instead of the 6-8hrs promised
column3: she usually got a good 5 usable hours prior to coming down.  She was arguementative about homework at night unless it was done right after school (which we started doing w/my mom).  She developed a very loud
column4: annoying and very  disruptive verbal tic.  (Think throat clearing loud enough to hurt your ears within 3 feet of her).  So we are switching to Strattera to try it and we'll see.  The Ritalin was pretty good though
column5: she complained of stomach pain sometimes and I think that was the medicine.  But overall
column6: no weight loss (just smaller gains than prior on the growth chart but it remained consistant) normal growth rate
column7: appetite was less so for lunch but good the rest of the day.  She did SO much better in school and her ability to concentrate when it was working was great.  An overall good improvement
column8: but the tic thing was an overwhelming side effect that was detrimental to school and social situations.  I think the tic was brought out from stress
column10: am not sure.  I'm hoping she will do good on the Strattera
column11: but it bothers me there is no other way to treat this that doesn't involve potentially mood altering drugs.....

column1: 25$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$11/20/2007 3:39:20 PM$Reviewer: 3-6 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months$4$4$5$My daughter has been taking this medication for about 6 weeks. The difference in her school performance is amazing. She can stay on task much better and her socialization has improved greatly. The only side effect so far is she gets very emotional in the late afternoon(crying/whinning)
column2: but this seems to be improving somewhat. We are pleased with this medication as our first ADHD med.

column1: 26$Condition: Attention Deficit Disorder with Hyperactivity$10/20/2007 12:34:23 PM$Reviewer: pawprints1959
column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$5$5$This medication has made a tremendous difference in my life. I was diagnosed at 45 years old with ADHD and wonder how much better my life could have been if I'd been diagnosed as a child!
